instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00480: What is 820-00480? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SCREEN ISSUE?
threads.message:
Hello I received this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A), the screen shows image, it shows the login screen por a moment and then only some lines. This looks like screen issue to me but I do not have one good to test so I would need to other the replacement. 

You think this is screen problem? The computer works fine with external monitor. Thanks!
[ATTACH]60600[/ATTACH][ATTACH]60601[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SCREEN ISSUE?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00480</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A SCREEN ISSUE?
threads.message:
that's a screen flex problem.

I have repaired some LCDs
